treatment.reference: Transfer of Halobacterium saccharovorum, Halobacterium sodomense, Halobacterium trapanicum NRC 34021 and Halobacterium lacusprofundi to the Genus Halorubrum gen. nov., as Halorubrum saccharovorum comb. nov., Halorubrum sodomense comb. nov., Halorubrum trapanicum comb. nov., and Halorubrum lacusprofundi comb. nov. Syst Appl Micriobiol 18:237-243
treatment.description: Thin rod-shaped cells up to 12 µm long, but pleomorphic; cells readily occur. Strictly aerobic. Oxidase and catalase positive. Growth occurs in media containing > 1 M NaCl; optimum concentration 2.5-3.5 M. Temperature range for growth 4- 45°C; optimum 31-37°C. Chemoorganotrophic. Many carbon sources (glucose, galactose, mannose, ribose, lactose, succinate, formate, acetate, ethanol) are utilized without acid production. Gelatin and starch arc not hydrolysed. Indole is not produced. The polar lipids are C20, C20 derivatives of PG, PGP, PGS and a sulphated mannosyl-glucosyl diether glycolipid. Isolated from Deep Lake Antarctica. The mol % G+C is 65.3-65.8 (Bd) depending on strain. A minor DNA component is present with G+C content of 54.8- 56.5% depending on strain. Type strain: ACAM 34. Gas vacuoles absent.
